Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 26ccae32112679c4653c1e3f8a1203c828bea05c

What coding standard? 
Can you include a link? or a link to something like https://quuxplusone.github.io/blog/2021/11/09/pass-string-view-by-value/
Done
huh? why remove this change ? it was patchset 1

Because this is a case where the string_view actually represents a mutable structure, not just a pass through.  It's used to communicate how many characters were processed.  string_view is arguably the wrong data structure for this transform, and std library stuff would normally just return a size_t for "# of characters processed" or an iterator of where it got to, but that's not what happened in this case.

I can add it to my list to clean up.
Ack
FYI, the "real" fix is here: https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/61111
Same here, string_view actually represents a mutable structure.
Yep.  This API is actually super unsafe (although our usages look ok)  This should arguably be swapped with string at some point.
